paragraphs.content: To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David.

paragraphs.content: The king shall joy in thy strength, O LORD; and in thy salvation how greatly shall he rejoice!
paragraphs.contentHtml: The king shall joy in thy strength, O Lord; and in thy salvation how greatly shall he rejoice!

paragraphs.content: Thou hast given him his heart’s desire, and hast not withholden the request of his lips. Selah.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou hast given him his heart’s desire, and hast not withholden the request of his lips. Selah.

paragraphs.content: For thou preventest him with the blessings of goodness: thou settest a crown of pure gold on his head.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For thou preventest him with the blessings of goodness: thou settest a crown of pure gold on his head.

paragraphs.content: He asked life of thee, and thou gavest it him, even length of days for ever and ever.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He asked life of thee, and thou gavest it him, even length of days for ever and ever.

paragraphs.content: His glory is great in thy salvation: honour and majesty hast thou laid upon him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: His glory is great in thy salvation: honour and majesty hast thou laid upon him.

paragraphs.content: For thou hast made him most blessed for ever: thou hast made him exceeding glad with thy countenance.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For thou hast made him most blessed for ever: thou hast made him exceeding glad with thy countenance.

paragraphs.content: For the king trusteth in the LORD, and through the mercy of the most High he shall not be moved.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For the king trusteth in the Lord, and through the mercy of the most High he shall not be moved.

paragraphs.content: Thine hand shall find out all thine enemies: thy right hand shall find out those that hate thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thine hand shall find out all thine enemies: thy right hand shall find out those that hate thee.

paragraphs.content: Thou shalt make them as a fiery oven in the time of thine anger: the LORD shall swallow them up in his wrath, and the fire shall devour them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou shalt make them as a fiery oven in the time of thine anger: the Lord shall swallow them up in his wrath, and the fire shall devour them.

paragraphs.content: Their fruit shalt thou destroy from the earth, and their seed from among the children of men.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Their fruit shalt thou destroy from the earth, and their seed from among the children of men.

paragraphs.content: For they intended evil against thee: they imagined a mischievous device, which they are not able to perform.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For they intended evil against thee: they imagined a mischievous device, which they are not able to perform.

paragraphs.content: Therefore shalt thou make them turn their back, when thou shalt make ready thine arrows upon thy strings against the face of them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Therefore shalt thou make them turn their back, when thou shalt make ready thine arrows upon thy strings against the face of them.

paragraphs.content: Be thou exalted, LORD, in thine own strength: so will we sing and praise thy power.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Be thou exalted, Lord, in thine own strength: so will we sing and praise thy power.
